data.sampled: Ebola can be treated through early diagnosis and prompt treatment. Treatment typically involves providing supportive care such as hydration, nutrition, and symptom management while the body fights off the virus. Some experimental medicines have shown promise in treating Ebola but more research is needed. It is important that those who are infected receive medical attention as soon as possible to increase chances of survival. Prevention measures include avoiding contact with bodily fluids of infected animals or people, practicing good hand washing and sanitation practices, and receiving vaccination when available. It is also important for healthcare workers to follow proper protocols to prevent spread of disease within hospitals. For updates on current treatment options, it is recommended to consult official sources such as the World Health Organization (WHO) or Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The statement "this lesbian is considered a father in Indiana" could be interpreted literally or ironically depending on context and tone, which are lacking in text-based communication. In order to accurately assess whether there is sarcasm present in the message, more information is needed, such as additional details about the situation, the speaker's attitude towards it, and their intended meaning. It may also be helpful to consider any nonverbal cues or other forms of communication (e.g., body language, vocal inflection, etc.) that might provide clues as to whether the message was meant sarcastically or sincerely. Sarcasm can often depend on subtleties of language use and context, so without sufficient evidence or clarification, it cannot be definitively classified as being present or absent. data.sampled:
I do not have access to any external websites that might provide information on filing taxes. If you are looking for advice about how to reduce stress when filing taxes, here are some general tips:

1. Start early and give yourself plenty of time to gather all necessary documents and fill out forms accurately. This can help prevent last-minute rush and errors.
2. Keep organized by using folders or files to store receipts and other important paperwork. Consider keeping digital copies for easy access and backup.
3. Use tax preparation software or consider hiring a professional tax preparer to assist you in filling out your returns. They may be able to identify deductions or credits that you were unaware of, potentially reducing your overall stress level and resulting in a larger refund.
4. Take breaks during the process and allow yourself time to relax and recharge. Stress can make it more difficult to concentrate and make mistakes while filing.
5. Finally, remember that mistakes happen - even to professionals! Don’t hesitate to seek guidance from a tax expert or accountant if needed. And if you owe money to the government, try to pay as much as you can afford up front rather than risk incurring additional penalties and interest later down the line. Remember that many people find filing their taxes daunting but taking things one step at a time can really ease the burden.
